title: How to Turn Off Google News Alerts on Lock & Home Screens

steps.title: Tap your profile icon in the Google News app.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon in the Google News app. A menu panel will appear. Use this method if Google News notifications appear on your lock screen or Home screen.

steps.title: Tap News settings.
steps.content: Tap News settings . This opens your app settings. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select Notifications from the “Alerts” section.
steps.content: Select Notifications from the “Alerts” section. Now, you will see your News notification options.

steps.title: Turn off "Get notifications."
steps.content: Turn off "Get notifications." When this toggle switch is disabled, you will no longer get news alerts on your Android. If you still get news notifications after disabling them in Google News, see this method to check for and delete the Breaking News Briefs app.

steps.title: Press and hold a blank area of your home screen.
steps.content: Press and hold a blank area of your home screen. This can be anywhere there are no widgets or icons. Use this method if you see a Google News or Samsung News feed when you swipe left on your Home screen and want to remove this feature.

steps.title: Tap Settings or similar.
steps.content: Tap Settings or similar. The option you see will depend on your Android model, but it will usually say "Settings" or display a gear icon.

steps.title: Disable the "Add media page to Home screen."
steps.content: Disable the "Add media page to Home screen." Tap the switch to toggle it to the off position. Once this switch is turned off, you will no longer see news on the leftmost Home screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Uninstall the Breaking News Brief app.
steps.content: Uninstall the Breaking News Brief app. Many Android owners have reported news headlines appearing on their lock screens out of nowhere. It turns out a potential malware app called "Breaking News Brief" had installed itself, usually after they clicked an ad. Deleting this app will remove news from the lock screen and disable pesky breaking news notifications. Open the Google Play Store app. Tap your profile icon at the top-right. Tap Manage apps & devices . Tap Manage . If you see "Breaking News Brief" in the list, select it and tap Uninstall . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the Google News widget (Pixel tablets only).
steps.content: Remove the Google News widget (Pixel tablets only). The release of Android 15 brought lock screen widgets back to Android Pixel tablets only. If there's a Google News widget on your Pixel tablet's lock screen, you can remove it by long-pressing the widget and dragging it to the Remove option.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Google News widget on your Home screen.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Google News widget on your Home screen. If you see news headlines in a widget on the Home screen, you can remove it like you would any other app.

steps.title: Tap Remove to remove the widget.
steps.content: Tap Remove to remove the widget. The Google News widget will no longer appear on your Home screen. [4] X Research source
